content:
TITLE: Deploying Eureka Server WAR to Tomcat
DESCRIPTION: Copies the compiled Eureka server Web Application Archive (WAR) file from the build output directory to the Tomcat webapps directory for deployment. Assumes the project has been built and the TOMCAT_HOME environment variable is set.
SOURCE: https://github.com/netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-examples/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
cp ./eureka-server/build/libs/eureka-server-XXX-SNAPSHOT.war $TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/eureka.war
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Eureka Server Startup Options in Tomcat
DESCRIPTION: Sets Java Virtual Machine (JVM) options within Tomcat's 'setenv.sh' script to optimize Eureka server startup for demo purposes. These options disable safeguards like waiting for sync and registry sync retries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-examples/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
JAVA_OPTS=" \
  -Deureka.waitTimeInMsWhenSyncEmpty=0 \
  -Deureka.numberRegistrySyncRetries=0"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Eureka Example Service Directly via Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Executes the example Eureka service directly using the Gradle wrapper task 'runExampleService'. This command starts the service, which will then attempt to register with a running Eureka server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-examples/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
./gradlew :eureka-examples:runExampleService
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Eureka Example Client Directly via Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Executes the example Eureka client directly using the Gradle wrapper task 'runExampleClient'. This command starts the client, which will discover and interact with the example service via Eureka.
SOURCE: https://github.com/netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-examples/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
./gradlew :eureka-examples:runExampleClient
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Governated Eureka Service Directly via Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Executes the Governator/Guice based example Eureka service directly using the Gradle wrapper task 'runExampleGovernatedService'. This provides an alternative initialization method using dependency injection.
SOURCE: https://github.com/netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-examples/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
./gradlew :eureka-examples:runExampleGovernatedService
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Governated Eureka Service from Distribution
DESCRIPTION: Executes the Governator/Guice based example Eureka service using the script provided in the built distribution package. Assumes the 'distZip' task has been run.
SOURCE: https://github.com/netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-examples/README.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
./bin/ExampleEurekaGovernatedService
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Eureka Examples Distribution Zip via Gradle
DESCRIPTION: Builds a distributable zip archive of the Eureka examples project using the Gradle wrapper task 'distZip'. This packages the examples for deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-examples/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
./gradlew :eureka-examples:distZip
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Eureka Example Service from Distribution
DESCRIPTION: Executes the example Eureka service using the script provided in the built distribution package. Assumes the 'distZip' task has been run and the user is in the distribution directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-examples/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
./bin/ExampleEurekaService
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Eureka Example Client from Distribution
DESCRIPTION: Executes the example Eureka client using the script provided in the built distribution package. Assumes the 'distZip' task has been run and the user is in the distribution directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/netflix/eureka/blob/master/eureka-examples/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
./bin/ExampleEurekaClient
```
